article_title: As many as 1,700 UCFS clients could lose health coverage

article_metadata.description: NORWICH — Cuts to Medicaid by the state mean that as many as 1,700 clients of United Community and Family Services could lose their health care coverage, UCFS and other health industry officials said Friday. Of particular concern is that those most affected by the cuts would be low-income families, parents and children and other vulnerable populations, those who attended Friday's panel at UCFS on the cuts said.Connecticut currently offers Medicaid HUSKY A care to parents whose
article_metadata.author: Ryan Blessing
